channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How Trump’s Blunt-Force Diplomacy Is Pushing His Rivals Together
item.description: Some of President Trump’s pressure tactics appear to have backfired, sending would-be allies into the embrace of China.

item.title: Would Anyone Use a Chinese Stablecoin?
item.description: A new law in Hong Kong could pave the way for digital currencies tied to China.

item.title: Food Delivery Drivers Feel Strain of Italy’s Ban on Outdoor Work on Hottest Days
item.description: Delivery riders are already some of the most vulnerable workers of booming gig economies. During successive heat waves this summer in Italy, it got co...

item.title: Anthropic settles with authors in first-of-its-kind AI copyright infringement lawsuit
item.description: A U.S. district court is scheduled to consider whether to approve the settlement next week, in a case that marked the first substantive decision on ho...

item.title: Alcaraz beats Djokovic at the U.S. Open and will meet Sinner for Grand Slam final
item.description: Sinner is trying to become the first repeat men's champion in New York since Roger Federer won the tournament five years in a row. Alcaraz hasn't drop...

item.title: Judge blocks Trump administration's ending of protections for Venezuelans and Haitians
item.description: A federal judge on Friday blocked the Trump administration from ending temporary legal protections for more than 1 million people from Haiti and Venez...

item.title: A Japanese Island Preserves an Ancient and Ghostly Theater Form
item.description: Noh was once the entertainment of medieval warriors. Today, remote Sado Islanders embrace one of the world’s oldest surviving types of drama.

item.title: With ‘Ghost Bat’ Drone, Australia Gears Up for New Arms Race
item.description: A new class of aircraft developed with Boeing, it will be the first military plane designed and manufactured in the country in half a century.

item.title: With ‘Ghost Bat’ Drone, Australia Gears Up for New Arms Race
item.description: A new class of aircraft developed with Boeing, it will be the first military plane designed and manufactured in the country in half a century.

item.title: American Who Posed as Irish Heiress Is Found Guilty of Theft and Fraud
item.description: Marianne Smyth was convicted in Northern Ireland, and could face up to 10 years in prison.

item.title: Thrust Into the Line of Fire, Iranians Worry About What Comes Next
item.description: A 12-day war in June upended the shadow war rivalry between Israel and Iran. Some Iranians want to strike back, others want to move on.

item.title: Large Shark Kills Surfer Near Sydney, Police Say
item.description: The authorities in Australia closed beaches in the northern Sydney suburbs after the attack.

item.title: What to Know About a Rapid U.S. Military Buildup in the Caribbean
item.description: The United States has deployed eight warships, several surveillance planes and one attack submarine to the region as tensions with Venezuela grow.

item.title: Under Trump, the Federal Trade Commission is abandoning its ban on noncompetes
item.description: Federal Trade Commission Chair Andrew Ferguson has called his agency's rule banning noncompetes unconstitutional. Still, he says protecting workers ag...

item.title: Anthropic to pay authors $1.5B to settle lawsuit over pirated chatbot training material
item.description: The artificial intelligence company Anthropic has agreed to pay authors $3,000 per book in a landmark settlement over pirated chatbot training materia...
